sentences.en: At my friendly jesting, his tension melted away.
sentences.cn: 他紧张的心情,被我这一番笑谈, 一下子冲得烟消云散了.

sentences.en: Do not mind, he is jesting.
sentences.cn: 别介意, 他是开玩笑.

sentences.en: He enjoyed drinking and jesting with his cronies.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢和老朋友喝喝酒、开开玩笑。

sentences.en: He is awfully fond of jesting.
Heedless of everyone's jesting remarks, Fang put down his glass and followed her.
sentences.cn: 方鸿渐顾不得人家说笑话, 放下杯子跟出去.
我一点儿也不是说笑话.

sentences.en: It was a jest rather than a reproach.
Often of a morning Babbitt came bouncing and jesting in to breakfast.
sentences.cn: 巴比特往常总是兴冲冲地,有说有笑地下楼吃早饭.

sentences.en: She was not entirely at ease with the jesting birdsong .
sentences.cn: 她和爱开玩笑的伯德桑在一起并不感到很自在。

sentences.en: She was not entirely at ease with the jesting Birdsong.
sentences.cn: 她和爱开玩笑的伯德桑在一起并不感到很自在.

sentences.en: Stop jesting and be serious for a moment!
sentences.cn: 别开玩笑了,严肃一会儿吧!

sentences.en: The cloud of spectators followed, jesting , in a paroxysm of delight.
sentences.cn: 一大群观众, 乐到发狂, 嘴里胡言乱语,都跟着走.

sentences.en: There is no jesting in war.

sentences.cn: 这实在不是闹着玩儿的

sentences.en: Throughout the interview she kept her temper perfectly , laughing and jesting.
sentences.cn: 在整个会见过程中,她从容不迫, 谈笑自如.

sentences.en: We are not jesting; This is the inevitable trend of the war.
sentences.cn: 这丝毫也不是笑话, 而是战争的必然的趋势.

words.tran_cn: （中世纪宫廷或贵族家中的）小丑；爱开玩笑的人
爱开玩笑的；打趣的；滑稽的

trans.tran_cn: 爱开玩笑的，说着玩的，打趣的

trans.tran_en: A jest is something you say that is intended to be amusing

trans.tran_cn: 说笑话，开玩笑( jest的现在分词 )
